About

I am a PhD student at CEA LIST under the supervision of Sebastien Bardin, Arnaud Goetlieb and Nadjib Lazaar. My research focuses on combining formal methods and artificial intelligence for binary analysis.

I am interrested by artificial intelligence and cybersecurity – more specifically by software security. I leverage aritificial intelligence with deductive methods to perform reverse engineering, software validation and testing.

I received in 2018 my Engineering and Master degree from Télécom SudParis (Évry, France) specialised in cybersecurity. I also obtained the Expert of information systems security certification from the National Cybersecurity Agency of France (ANSSI – Agence Nationale de la Sécurité des Systèmes d’Information).

Previous Research Experiences

2018 I worked at FORTH-ICS under the supervision of Dr. Ioannidis on android malware analysis. I performed a preliminary study on the use of cryptojackers in android apps from different markets.
